feed.title: Search about Coronavirus (COVID-19) in News and communications

entry.title: Local COVID alert level update for South Yorkshire
entry.summary: South Yorkshire will move from local COVID alert level high to very high from 00.01 on Saturday 24 October.

entry.title: Sewage signals early warning of coronavirus outbreaks
entry.summary: Government-led programme is providing an early warning of coronavirus outbreaks by monitoring sewage and sharing data with NHS Test & Trace

entry.title: Chancellor statement to the House – Plan For Jobs
entry.summary: Statement, as delivered by Chancellor Rishi Sunak, on 22 October 2020.

entry.title: Weekly national flu and COVID-19 surveillance reports published
entry.summary: National influenza and COVID-19 report, monitoring coronavirus (COVID-19) activity, seasonal flu and other seasonal respiratory illnesses.

entry.title: Canary Islands, Denmark, Maldives and Mykonos added to travel corridor exempt list
entry.summary: From 4am Sunday 25 October, people arriving in England from the Canary Islands, Denmark, the Maldives and Mykonos will not need to self-isolate.

entry.title: Local COVID alert level update: Coventry, Slough and Stoke-on-Trent
entry.summary: These 3 areas will move to local COVID alert level high from Saturday 24 October.

entry.title: Prime Minister's statement on coronavirus (COVID-19): 22 October 2020
entry.summary: Prime Minister Boris Johnson made a statement at the coronavirus press conference.

entry.title: Coronavirus debate: opening speech
entry.summary: Speech by Secretary of State for Health and Social Care to open a debate in House of Commons on the coronavirus pandemic.

entry.title: Millions of extra flu jabs available to support largest UK vaccination programme
entry.summary: Over 30 million people to be vaccinated this year to protect them from flu and support the NHS.

entry.title: Oral Statement: Quarterly report on progress to address COVID-19 health inequalities
entry.summary: The Minister for Equalities’ Oral Statement to the House, on the first quarterly report to the Prime Minister and Health Secretary on progress to understand and tackle COVID-19 disparities experienced by individuals from an …

entry.title: NHS Test and Trace statistics for 8 October to 14 October
entry.summary: NHS Test and Trace successfully reached 80.7% of people who tested positive and 75.1% of contacts where communication details were provided, latest figures show.

entry.title: Plan for Jobs: Chancellor increases financial support for businesses and workers
entry.summary: The government today announced it will significantly increase the generosity and reach of its winter support schemes to ensure livelihoods and jobs across the UK continue to be protected in the difficult months to come, supp…

entry.title: Direction issued to the Chief Regulator of Ofqual
entry.summary: Directions from Gavin Williamson MP, Secretary of State for Education, to Sally Collier, Chief Regulator of Ofqual, about awarding results for qualifications being assessed for summer 2020.

entry.title: Jenrick confirms allocations of £1 billion funding for councils this winter
entry.summary: Allocations confirmed for individual councils from the £1 billion of additional support announced by the Prime Minister earlier this month.

entry.title: Designated premises scheme: letter to directors of adult social services
entry.summary: The letter sets out arrangements for the Care Quality Commission designated premises scheme for people discharged to a care home with a positive COVID-19 test.

entry.title: Health Secretary warns of long-term effects of COVID-19 as new film released
entry.summary: New data suggests long COVID affects around 10% of 18 to 49 year olds who become unwell with COVID-19.

entry.title: New partnership with The Alan Turing Institute and Royal Statistical Society to support Joint Biosecurity Centre COVID-19 response
entry.summary: This new partnership will provide further statistical modelling and machine learning expertise to support the government’s response to COVID-19.

entry.title: Local COVID alert level update for Greater Manchester
entry.summary: Greater Manchester will move from local COVID alert level high to very high from 00.01 on Friday 23 October.

entry.title: Prime Minister's statement on coronavirus (COVID-19): 20 October 2020
entry.summary: Prime Minister Boris Johnson made a statement at the coronavirus press conference.

entry.title: Medical devices given exceptional use authorisations during the COVID-19 pandemic
entry.summary: List of manufacturers and their medical devices which have been granted an exemption by the MHRA.
